path: ./Audit_Reports_2024/QuillAudits/Azomland Smart Contract Initial Audit report - QuillAudits.pdf

findings.title: Return values of low-level calls
findings.description: The audit report highlights the potential issue of ignoring return values from low-level calls, which can lead to unexpected behavior or security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Missing Zero Address Validation
findings.description: The contract does not validate if an address is zero, which can lead to unexpected behavior.

findings.title: Using inline assembly
findings.description: The use of inline assembly can make the code harder to read and understand, potentially introducing security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Unlocked pragma (pragma solidity ^0.8.0)
findings.description: Contracts should be deployed with the same compiler version and flags that they have been tested with thoroughly. Locking the pragma helps to ensure that contracts do not accidentally get deployed using, for example, an outdated compiler version that might introduce bugs.
